reviews.text: Ok, its a while since we stayed in The Grange; Jul 05, but i felt i just had to give this B&B the highest possible recommendation.!
reviews.title: Pure Scottish Luxury

likes.disliked: — Location..Fort William itself is a little dingy..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is by a long way the best B&B we have ever stayed in. Joan was a total lady . Her home is so full of Scottish character and charm..the furnishings in the room go beyond luxury....even down to the toliet rolls having their own little mahogony chest, and the jug of brandy awaiting you...her website will show you what i mean..
reviews.title: A Real Find!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was superb...it wasnt just the lovely food...it was the surroundings, the ambience, and the attention to detail that made it special...just lke every aspect of our stay..
reviews.title: ten out of ten !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is little wonder that Jessica Lange stayed there during the filming of Rob Roy!
reviews.title: Absolute Perfection!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now, i didnt rate Fort William that highly, but if you are on a tour of Scotland, you really should give this gem of a B&B a visit.
reviews.title: What a fantastic place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Another wonderful review, in line with others on tripadviser. We spent 6 nights here recently in the Turret room. This "5 star" B&B lives up to it's reputation and it's web site. Full marks to Joan and her partner for making our stay in the gateway to the Scottish Highlands so welcome.
reviews.title: Wonderful B&B in wonderful Scotland

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Highlights are many, and include the attention to detail and friendliness. The breakfast menu is extensive and well presented - often too much for our English stomachs (we joked that Seamus the dog lives well on leftovers!). The Porridge with Whisky is a must!
reviews.title: Outstanding!!!
Perfect in every way
reviews.text: B&B is in a quiet location up a short steep road from the Loch Linney main road, but has wonderful views of the Loch from all rooms and garden. It's a 10-15 minute walk into Fort William centre, or right on the Cow Hill path if you are a walker and want a superb view of the area and Ben Nevis!

We headed in all directions in the car to visit just a few of the tourist sights to be seen in this wonderful part of the world, as well as a few walks. Having been on numerous holidays in the South of England, we were amazed to find very few "Pay & Display" car parks in the Highlands - the only memeorable exception being the ludricous charges at Glinfinnen, where the Scottish National Trust seem to be exploiting connections with the Harry Potter stories.
reviews.title: Gorgeous victorian villa - the most beautiful place to be!!
Beautiful setting and excellent hospitality
reviews.text: As others have noted, there are some very good restaurants in the area for Lunch & Dinner. Good ones were Cafe 163 and the Glen Nevis Restaurant. Avoid the "No.4" as it was overpriced and seemed to be run by foriegn students.

reviews.title: Absolutely Gorgeous
reviews.text: We have just returned from 2 nights in Fort William where we stayed at The Grange. We had a wonderful time. The guesthouse is immaculate, beautifully and stylishly furnished. The attention to detail was second to none.
We stayed in the Rob Roy room which was lovely, with beautiful views over the loch. The breakfast was lovely, as was the home made shortbread we had with our welcome tea.
reviews.title: A beutiful house in a beautiful part of the world!

description: The Grange offers you exceptional luxury accommodation while you take time to experience and explore the Highlands of Scotland.Our B&B is graded at the highest standard by Visit Scotland and holds other awards for the quaility of the accommodation and the welcome and attention provided by your hosts.The Grange 5 star luxury bed and breakfast accommodation is at the west end of Fort William and is set in its own grounds overlooking Loch Linnhe offering exceptional B&B in a lovingly restored Victorian town house with a friendly atmosphere. All bedrooms are designed and dressed to a very high standard with private facilities and views over Loch Linnhe and you will find a thoughful selection of finishing touches to enhance your stay.
